pitchLine: My passions are — cloud architecture, devops, clean code, setting up teams, tramping and travelling.

projects.name: Review and Recommendations
projects.description: Aquiba has an active radio integration program to deliver digital water meters with world beating metrology and excellent product durability which are compatible with Utility network infrastructure. The proposed future for Aquiba being at scale created a need to review their initial in-house implementation with a view to providing it with a degree of hardness and robustness to service existing customers while the commercial and digital strategy evolved into a fully integrated vertical offering in the utility industry.
achievements: tenancy, account, and subscription topology. Highlighting structural, operational, cost and security issues
review of existing ad-hoc vm infrastructure
network vulnerabilities with emphasis on DDoS exposure from UDP
review of DevOps: repositories, development practices, feature / release cycles, code security, developer task management, IaaC and release pipelines
review of application and vm logging
review of logging differentiation: metrics, trace, dependency, exceptions, availability and requests
code review: SANS SWAT, CWE, code smell, refactoring and home-rolled cryptography

projects.name: Phase 1: Core Implementation
projects.description: The review and recommendations above resulted in a phased approach to transition to recommendations. The Phase 1 focused on core Azure setup and hardening.
achievements: topology: implemented management groups, subscription isolation, cost and billing control
security: implemented RBAC, MFA, PIM. Security Centre and its recommendations
implemented Azure Key Vault
vm's: hardened with JIT through PIM, added anti-malware, encrypted disks, added performance monitoring
implemented CI/CD via IaaC for VM's
implemented scale sets
upgraded DDoS on VNet
DevOps: implemented full IaaC via Pulumi, Blueprints and ARM. Centralised repositories on Azure DevOps. Implemented GitFlow Branching and Pull Requests
logging and monitoring: implemented AppInsights, Azure Monitor, VM and network logging via Azure Monitor

projects.name: Phase 2: Kubernetes, Istio, APIM
projects.description: Phase 2 was the transition to Kubernetes and a micro-service architecture. It also included the creation of a developer portal for the Aquiba Utility customers to access Water Meter data and management.
achievements: created DEV,UAT and PROD VNets
created VNet Subnets for DataLake, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes, APIM, GateWays
applied NSG's
created Azure Kubernetes Cluster
deployed Istio
dockerised existing Node/Express app
exposed public UDP endpoint to Water Meters
implmented APIM and WAF for their Customer API
created Aquiba Developer Portal for Utility Customers

projects.name: Phase 3: Service Separation
projects.description: This phase separated the single NodeJS/Express app into two separate services. One for the IoT / UDP endpoint servicing the Smart Water Meters and the other the Utility customer API.
achievements: isolated and optimised UDP code
isolated and optimised API code
created CI/CD pipelines
deployed to Kubernetes

projects.name: Enterprise Integration Strategy and Principles
projects.description: Establishment of Comvita's Integration strategy and Enterprise development principles
achievements: educated business on benefits of moving from BBoM to Domain Driven
established principles: Event Driven, API First, Domain Centric, Decentralised, Encapsulated, Automated, Fail Safe, Secure, Observable, Self Healing, Documented and Clean Code
high level architecture design
educated Comvita IT Team
worked with stakeholders

projects.name: Integration Team Establishment
projects.description: Establishment of Comvita's Offshore Integration development team based in Vietnam
achievements: traveled and live in Ho Chi Minh Vietnam
used Vietnamese contacts to recruit team
conducted technical and soft interviews
upskilled the development team in Azure and integration principles
established development best practices
established continuous integration and deployment pipelines
established modified Agile Scrum methodology
integrated ticketing and support systems into workflow
supported existing MuleSoft integrations

projects.name: Development and Release of Integrations
projects.description: Establishment of Comvita's Offshore Integration development team based in Vietnam
achievements: ERP integrations: QAD, Kingdee
3PL integrations: MainFreight, DPD, Amazon
Loyalty integrations: XGate
POS integrations: CBR and TTRetail
Identity integrations: Azure AD, AD, BambooHR, Salesforce
HR integration: BambooHR
Health and Safety integrations: She Assure
Apiary Management integration: Comvita AMS
Quality integrations: OnQ, Analytica, Assure Quality
CRM integration: Salesforce
Commerce integrations: Oracle ATG, QAD, Commerce Tools, Amazon, TMall, JD.com, Koala
Content Management integrations: WebDam and Contentful
Planning and Analytics integrations: Adaptive Insights, PowerBI, DataBricks
Supplier management integration: Esker
EDM integration: Marketo
Manufacturing: Scada
Document management integrations: Kaboodle Intranet and Office 365
Communication tool integrations: Yammer, Teams, Outlook
Social integrations: Twitter and Facebook

volunteer.description: I conducted a series of lectures for BIONIC University. Main topics: HTML / CSS / jQuery / Handlebars / Ajax / Production experience / Best practices

travel.description: We are currently travelling the South Island of New Zealand as a family, doing some of the Great Walks and as much tramping, swimming and outdoor activities as we can.

travel.description: 2020 started off with travel from Croatia to Vietnam for work for 3 months. This was cut short due to COVID. We returned to the UK and had plans to head to Norway before COVID hit again. We then retreated to Australia to visit grandparents. We have now returned home to NZ.
